intro: Tribulus cistoides f. anacanthus, commonly known as the spiny cist, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its distinctive spiny structures and adaptive features make it well-suited for survival in harsh conditions.
